pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:0.4: The sub-chapter on the dark of the night
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:0.5: 18. The training rule on complaining about others
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.2: At that time a nun who was a pupil of Bhaddā Kāpilānī attended on her with care.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.3: Bhaddā Kāpilānī said to the nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.4: “Venerables, this nun is attending on me with care. I’ll give her a robe.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.5: Then, because of misunderstanding and a lack of proper reflection, that nun complained about Bhaddā Kāpilānī,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.6: “Venerables, if I didn’t attend on her with care, she wouldn’t give me a robe.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.7: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.8: “How could a nun complain about someone else because of misunderstanding and a lack of proper reflection?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.12: “How could a nun act in this way?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.14: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.15.1: ‘If a nun complains about someone else because of misunderstanding and a lack of proper reflection, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.1.7: Because of a lack of proper reflection:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.1.10: if she complains about one who is fully ordained, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.1: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives them as such, and she complains about them, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.2: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she complains about them, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.3: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive them as such, and she complains about them, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.4: If she complains about someone who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.5: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.6: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.7: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.3.3: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.3.4: The eighth training rule is finished.
